text: The Hibbettage is a historic mansion in Nashville, Tennessee, U.S.. It was built in 1938 for B. K. Hibbett. It was designed in the Colonial Revival architectural style by George D. Waller, who was inspired by The Hermitage. Construction was discontinued due to World War II, and it was resumed in 1948. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since October 30, 1998. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee Category:Colonial Revival architecture in Tennessee Category:Houses completed in 1948 Category:Houses in Nashville, Tennessee
title: The Hibbettage
